newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: BOTSWANA STOCKS WEEK - PRICES RISE ON BOURSE.
newsitem.headline: BOTSWANA STOCKS WEEK - PRICES RISE ON BOURSE.

text.p: Prices continued to rise on
the Botswana Stock Exchange with the index gaining 5.29 points
or 1.3 percent to reach 425.78 points.
First National rose 10 thebe to 500 thebe and
security group Inco saw a large trade of over 300,000
shares at 75 thebe before closing at 85 thebe.
Investment company Kgolo ya Sechaba traded up five
thebe to recah 185 thebe, clothing chain Pep put on 10
thebe and traded at 290 thebe, Standard Chartered
continued to rise, adding 15 thebe to 580 thebe.
Brewery holding company Sechaba traded unchanged
at 300 thebe as did Botswana Insurance at 220 thebe on
small volume.
On the foreign board, McCarthy Retail put on eight
thebe to close at 1,150 thebe with 900 shares traded. Regent
Undervalued Assets Fund was untraded, closing at 4,000
thebe. The foreign index lost 12.97 points to close at 394.30
points.
The all companies index shed 12.51 points to 395.10 points.
